description: في زمن ليس بالبعيد في تسعينيات القرن الماضي ولدت شركة غيرت العالم وشاركت في تحويل أفكار تيم بيرنرز-لي من آداه نخبوية للمهاويس إلى أهم تقنية في عالمنا المعاصر. نيتسكيب Netscape أصدرت أول متصفح لها عام 1994 مستحوذة على 90% من سوق المتصفحات للويب طوال منتصف التسعينات ومحققة رقم قياسي لأعلى ارتفاع لقيمة...

data.message: It is pretty much for free, $40 for upgrade.

Yes and should be even less. The OS is becoming like the browser, no one will pay to get it eventually. Microsoft is performing well till now redefinig the business model and revenue generation. Especially they have already a diverse model like XBox, and Azure
It is not gonna be free unless Microsoft started hiding its cost inside the Hardware the same way Apple does it, which is just playing with numbers, nothing is actually free.

If I were Microsoft marketing in Egypt, I would pay to distribute genuine copies for free, but facilitating the entry to the Software Store ecosystem. For example distributing a copy of Windows with DSL subscription on a condition of X amount to be spent on the store with the bill included with the DSL payment to mitigate the scarcity of credit cards, and other e-payment methods. And HW is one source of revenue, others include revenue from the app store, revenue from Enterprise sales, from ISV buying development tools, or hosting on Azure.

I have no idea about the promotions that will be available in Egypt, but for Developers there are usually many ways to get All Microsoft software for free or for very limited price, like DreamSpark, BizSpark, WebSpark, and MSDN Subscriptions.

Sure, I have two MSDN Ultimate subscribtions for free through different programs, but I am talking about creating a consumer ecosystem. This ecosystem will build an infrastructure for a mature consumer software development industry in Egypt. And the powerhorse that can drive such ecosystem is Microsoft.
75% of Windows licenses are being sold as part of a new PC purchase, which is the case for the normal consumer anyway
Not in Egypt where the locally assembled desktops are not part of this ecosystem, and don't forget the upgrades.
